entries.output:
TUBES COMMANDS

Learning & Navigation:
  /help                    - This help message
  /mode self               - Learn about Tubes architecture  
  /mode tasks              - Work with tasks (set TUBES_DIR)
  /open <path>             - View file or directory
  /open internal/tui/model.go  - Example: view Model definition
  
UI Controls:
  /ui split 0.3            - Set left column to 30%
  /ui input 2              - Set input area to 2 lines
  /ui inspect              - View current layout settings
  /toggle                  - Expand/collapse navigation item
  /copy                    - Toggle text selection mode
  
Development:
  /run compile             - Build project 
  /run test               - Run tests
  /clear                  - Refresh left panel
  
Multi-Cursor System:
  /save-cursor <name>      - Save current selection as snapshot
  /load-cursor <name>      - Load cursor snapshot
  /list-cursors            - Show all saved snapshots
  /cursor-status           - Show multi-cursor status

Command History:
  /history [n]             - Show recent command history (default 10)
  /history-stats           - Show command statistics and performance
  /history-llm [n]         - Generate LLM-friendly context (default 5)
  /recall [n]              - Recall previous command output (n=index)
  
Server Control:
  /server status          - Check API server status  
  /server start           - Start HTTP API server
  /server stop            - Stop HTTP API server
  
API Integration:
  /api                    - Show HTTP endpoints
  curl localhost:8081/api/list  - External API access (after /server start)
  
Tips:
  - Shift-Tab to cycle between panels (left/right/input)
  - W/S for navigation in left panel
  - Up/Down arrows in input for command history
  - Tab within panels for internal focus  
  - Use /copy or Ctrl+Y to enable text selection
  - Use /ui commands to control layout
  - Start in /mode self to learn the system

  - Use /copy or Ctrl+Y to enable text selection

TUBES COMMANDS

Learning & Navigation:
  /help                    - This help message
  /mode self               - Learn about Tubes architecture  
  /mode tasks              - Work with tasks (set TUBES_DIR)
  /open <path>             - View file or directory
  /open internal/tui/model.go  - Example: view Model definition
  
UI Controls:
  /ui split 0.3            - Set left column to 30%
  /ui input 2              - Set input area to 2 lines
  /ui inspect              - View current layout settings
  /toggle                  - Expand/collapse navigation item
  /copy                    - Toggle text selection mode
  
Development:
  /run compile             - Build project 
  /run test               - Run tests
  /clear                  - Refresh left panel
  
Multi-Cursor System:
  /save-cursor <name>      - Save current selection as snapshot
  /load-cursor <name>      - Load cursor snapshot
  /list-cursors            - Show all saved snapshots
  /cursor-status           - Show multi-cursor status

Command History:
  /history [n]             - Show recent command history (default 10)
  /history-stats           - Show command statistics and performance
  /history-llm [n]         - Generate LLM-friendly context (default 5)
  /recall [n]              - Recall previous command output (n=index)
  
API Integration:
  /api                    - Show HTTP endpoints
  curl localhost:8080/api/list  - External API access
  
Tips:
  - Shift-Tab to cycle between panels (left/right/input)
  - W/S for navigation in left panel
  - Up/Down arrows in input for command history
  - Tab within panels for internal focus  
  - Use /copy or Ctrl+Y to enable text selection
  - Use /ui commands to control layout
  - Start in /mode self to learn the system

UI Commands:
  /ui split <ratio>     - Set left/right split (0.1-0.9)
  /ui input <height>    - Set input area height (1-5)
  /ui feedback <height> - Set feedback area height (1-3)
  /ui inspect          - Show current UI settings
  
Examples:
  /ui split 0.3        - Left column 30%, right 70%
  /ui input 2          - Two-line input area
  /ui inspect          - View all settings
